intro: Chiococca nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flowered chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in axillary inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that release small seeds when mature. Chiococca nudiflora is typically found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
